climbs.name: To Be, or Left of Bee

content.description:
Crack starts thin, then gets bigger further up with some tricky placements.  

  Great rest in the middle in a hueco.
content.protection: Standard rack, or toprope.   There are no anchors so be prepared to create an anchor, and if you make a top rope anchor you might need long lengths of static line or tube webbing.
content.location: Walking into the first area from the parking lot past the old homesteads, walk past a few boulders until you see the larger overhanging blocks. Turn left, walk past the white face which is Lichen or Not, and a corner. Past the corner you will see To Be, or Left of Bee on the next section of face. The leftmost of two parallel cracks. An obvious hueco midway up.

content.description: Climb the first 20' of moderate climbing until you gain a bit of a stance, then move through the thin crux towards the small waco feature. Don't get trapped!
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 bolted anchors.This can be toproped, as the anchors are within reach of the top.
content.location: Front area on The Bard Wall. Walk past the springhouse, the take your first right. Follow the trail as it decends into the boulder field. The Bard Wall is the first tall wall on your left as you enter overhung area.

content.description: One of the earliest climbs to go up. First assent by Frank Harvey before the other areas were discovered by Tony Robinson and Glenn Ritter.This is not to be missed! Really great movement with some reaching in the middle. Not quite vertical. Moderate climbing on good holds until the middle of the climb, then fun (1980ish) 5.9 crux, then great climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: This route was rebolted! It is now 5 bolts to anchors. The anchors remain within reach of the top, so the route can be top roped by walking around the backside of the climb.
content.location: Walking into the first area from the parking lot past the old homesteads, walk past a few boulders until you see the larger overhanging blocks.  Turn left and it is a tall white face just to the left side of a corner.

content.description: Start on the sculpted jug at chest height, and go straight up the juggy face.There are several other juggy V0's to the left and to the right.If this has already been done before, please post the previous route info so I can update it.
content.location: Just left of The diving board.35.866306, -84.890472

content.description: Sit start on the lowest shelf with your feet in the cave.  Go up through the big flat diving board, and top out.If this has already been done before, please post the previous route info so I can update it.
Great intro to chimney climbing. Climb the wide crack with good gear in horizontals. I was glad for a #6 up top, but it isn't necessary.
content.protection: Traditional gear. The anchors for a nearby toprope can be reached by hiking around to the top of the boulder. They are difficult to reach when leading this route however, and so the leader will want to top out around the side.
content.location: When entering the Front Area, it is the first major face on your left as you near the overhung area. The corner is the obvious crack in the Bard Wall.

content.description: The wall closest to the parking, and which saw the earliest development.
